gov.usgs.anss.edge

Class EdgeBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.edge.EdgeBlock

  • public class EdgeBlock
extends java.lang.Object
    this Block class just encapsulates a block in a data file with the additional data of the julian day and block number of the target, index block, extent index, node, and a sequence number. This is the format used to store and communicate between EdgeBlockQueues using Replication and EdgeBlockClients. The BUFFER_LENGTH is the size of the binay package: 
     Raw form is :

 off name  type  description
  0 julian int if negative this is a continuation (no seed header)
  4 node   char[4]
  8 blk    int (if -1, then this is an index block update).
 12 indexBlock int index block this is stored in
 16 index  int The extent index within the index block
 20 seq    int The sequence number assigned this block,
 24 seedname String*12 The seed name this block is associated with
 36 ms     byte[512] with data from mini-seed or index block.

      • set

        public void set(int julian,
                java.lang.StringBuilder nd,
                java.lang.StringBuilder seedName,
                int nblk,
                int indexBlock,
                int index,
                byte[] bf,
                int offset,
                int sequence)
        set the block to the given values
        Parameters:
        julian - The julian day
        nd - String with node of originating computer. (no more than 4 characters)
        seedName - The seedname associated with this block
        nblk - BLock in this julian day file for this block
        indexBlock - the index block that this data is recorded in
        index - The extent index in the index block corresponding to this data
        bf - A byte data buffer containing the data
        offset - The offset of the block within bf
        sequence - The sequence number to assign to this block

      • set

        public void set(byte[] bf,
                int offset,
                int sequence)
        set based on a raw buffer
        Parameters:
        bf - The raw buffer with BUFFER_LENGTH data
        offset - The offset in bf to start with
        sequence - The sequence number to assign to this block (if zero, leave it alone
